item.title: Report E-2024100626
item.description:
Report E-2024100626

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of MITFLOC 7983L had a loose cap and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior, pallet, and top of tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized a neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the site. The crew performed a tote transfer of the product and cut up the damaged tote for waste. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) cubic yard box for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100607
item.description:
Report E-2024100607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, an incident occurred at Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility located in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin. During a routine unloading operation, a Veolia employee was using a forklift to remove a pallet from a trailer when the forklift's forks accidentally punctured a drum positioned behind the pallet being unloaded. As a result of this incident, less than one gallon of waste flammable liquid was released from the punctured drum. Immediate action was taken to address the situation by promptly overpacking the damaged drum to prevent further leakage. Hazmat-trained Veolia employees conducted a thorough remediation of the spilled material. The swift response and proper handling of the situation by trained personnel ensured that the environmental impact was minimized and safety protocols were followed.
